summary: This is an email chain between an FBI Special Agent and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, discussing the identification of telecommunications service providers for several phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein during a relevant investigation period.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The sender of the email providing the identified service providers for phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The recipient who initially requested the service provider information for phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose phone numbers (cell, home, and NY office) are the subject of the law enforcement inquiry for service provider information.

events.title: Phone Record Provider Inquiry
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests, and an FBI Special Agent provides, the telecommunications service providers for phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein for a relevant investigation period.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's communications as of May 2019, specifically seeking his phone service providers.
The investigation involved collaboration between the FBI's VCAC/Human Trafficking unit in New York and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The inquiry covered multiple phone lines: a cell phone, a home phone, and the phone at Epstein's New York office.
The identified service providers were T-Mobile (cell), AT&T (home), Verizon (NY office), and AT&T (another cell phone).
